result.execSummary:
The defendant Mariah Philyce Hicks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.  
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall have no contact with Jakarya Wilson.
Expunction granted upon successful completion of probation.

Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
All conditions of probation imposed in Ct. 1 shall remain the same for Ct. 2.

records.addlTxt: Expungement upon successful completion of probation.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Mariah Philyce Hicks in court and by Attorney Edgar A. Beltran.  Resolution reached.  State takes no position on expungement.  State moves to dismiss and read in Cts. 3 & 4 and Court so orders.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 1 and Ct. 2.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mariah Philyce Hicks in court.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Mariah Philyce Hicks. Information rec'd and reading waived, not guilty pleas entered.
Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting Attorney Elizabeth A. Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Edgar A. Beltran appears for defendant.  Atty. Beltran informs the Court that defendant was present earlier.  Case passed.  Case recalled.  Defendant present.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.
Arraignment scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Prosecuting Attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not in court.  Atty. Edgar Beltran appears on behalf of defendant.  Defendant could not secure a ride to court.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
22R 006336 Bond received at Sheriff's Department per Receipt #14788 on 3-28-22
No consumption of alcohol. Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Prosecuting Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty. Wilfred de Junco.  Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Argument on bond.  $750 cash bond set.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing. State Public Defender to appoint counsel.
Hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
